aws::graph::propositions: # Aviation Accident in San Martin, California
The accident occurred in San Martin, California.
The accident occurred on May 31, 2013, at 09:55 Local time.
The aircraft involved was a Bellanca 7ECA.
The defining event was loss of control on ground.
The flight was conducted under Part 91: General aviation - Personal.
The accident number was WPR13CA255.
The aircraft registration was N5032G.
The aircraft sustained substantial damage.
There were no injuries in the accident.
The pilot approached the airport to land.
The pilot called for traffic advisories.
The pilot received no response to traffic advisories.
The pilot flew over the airport to observe the windsocks.
Windsocks are located at each end of the runway.
The pilot elected to land on runway 14.
During the landing roll, the airplane made a sudden turn to the right.
The airplane exited the right side of the runway.
The airplane came to rest on the grass.
During the accident sequence, the airplane's left wing sustained substantial damage.
At the time of the accident, the airport's weather system reported wind from 340 degrees at 10 knots.
The pilot reported no mechanical failures with the airframe.
The pilot reported no mechanical malfunctions with the airframe.
The pilot reported no mechanical failures with the engine.
The pilot reported no mechanical malfunctions with the engine.
No mechanical issues would have precluded normal operation of the aircraft.
The National Transportation Safety Board determined the probable cause of this accident.
The probable cause was the pilot's failure to maintain directional control during the landing roll.
The findings included aircraft directional control was not attained/maintained.
The findings included personnel issues related to aircraft control by the pilot.

text:
# Aviation Investigation Final Report

## Location:
San Martin, California

## Date & Time: 
May 31, 2013, 09:55 Local

## Aircraft:
Bellanca 7ECA

## Defining Event:
Loss of control on ground

## Flight Conducted Under:
Part 91: General aviation - Personal

## Accident Number:
WPR13CA255

## Registration:
N5032G

## Aircraft Damage:
Substantial

## Injuries:
1 None

## Analysis

The pilot reported that as she approached the airport to land she called for traffic advisories, however, received no response. She flew over the airport to observe the windsocks, which are located at each end of the runway, and elected to land on runway 14. During the landing roll, the airplane made a sudden turn to the right, exited the right side of the runway, and came to rest on the grass. During the accident sequence the airplane's left wing sustained substantial damage. At the time of the accident, the airport's weather system reported wind from 340 degrees at 10 knots. The pilot reported no mechanical failures or malfunctions with the airframe or engine that would have precluded normal operation.

## Probable Cause and Findings

The National Transportation Safety Board determines the probable cause(s) of this accident to be:
The pilot's failure to maintain directional control during the landing roll.

## Findings

| Element | Finding |
| --- | --- |
| Aircraft | Directional control - Not attained/maintained |
| Personnel issues | Aircraft control - Pilot |

---
